abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Highway Sector Project in Indonesia.
            The main objective of the project was to assist the
            govemment in improving the overall efficiency of the road
            subsector by supporting its Policy Statement and Action Plan
            (PSAP) for road transport and road use and comprehensive
            three-year expenditure plan for national and provincial
            roads. Bank performance was satisfactory.  Borrower’s
            performance was satisfactory. There were a few lessons to be
            learnt from this project's experience : (a) dealing
            with long-term  objectives, a new Policy Statement need not
            be designed for every sector project, but each such project
            should have a modular action plan; (b) rationalization of
            the institutional development and corresponding changes in
            the legal framework, should be viewed as a dynamic
            interactive process; and (c) investing in Technical
            Assistance (TA) and training for institutional capacity
            building purposes can yield high returns in terms of
            development effectiveness.

display_title.display_title:
Conformed Copy - L3133 - Highway

5078838.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Highway Sector
            Project is to assist the Government in improving the overall
            efficiency of the road subsector. The project aims to: (a)
            consolidate recent improvements in the formulation and
            implementation of highway expenditures; (b) institute
            improved policies on road use; (c) strengthen the
            institutions involved in the subsector; and (d) improve the
            quality of the road network by focussing on maintenance and
            rehabilitation / betterment works. The project includes: (i)
            technical assistance, studies and training to assist in the
            implementation of the Policy Statement and Action Plan
            (PS&AP) and the expenditure plan; (ii) specific
            subprojects of the expenditure plan selected annually on the
            basis of agreed procedures and economic and technical
            criteria. Major components for which loan proceeds will be
            used are road and bridge maintenance programs but other
            components will include road safety, technical assistance
            and training.
